snippet: In American society, concepts of masculinity and femininity have broadened while remaining fundamentally unchanged, an economist writes.
abstract: In American society, concepts of masculinity and femininity have broadened while remaining fundamentally unchanged, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. She recently edited and contributed to “For Love and Money: Care Provision in the United States.“

headline.main: The Future of the Gender Bend

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead (Book)
